practice.question: Function mein default parameter kaise set karte hain?
practice.answer: Function definition mein parameter ke saath default value assign kar dete hain. Example: function greet($name = 'Guest') { echo "Hello $name"; }

practice.question: $_SESSION aur $_COOKIE mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: $_SESSION data server par store hota hai (temporary), $_COOKIE user ke browser mein store hota hai (persistent). Session safer hota hai.

practice.question: File upload handle karne ke liye $_FILES array mein kya-kya information hoti hai?
practice.answer: name, type, tmp_name, error, size - ye sab information $_FILES array mein milti hai uploaded file ki.

practice.question: try-catch block ka use kyun karte hain?

<?php
// Function with parameters and return type
function add(int $a, int $b): int {
    return $a + $b;
}

// Function with default parameter
function greet(string $name = 'Guest'): string {
    return "Hello, $name!";
}

// Anonymous function (closure)
$multiply = function($x, $y) {
    return $x * $y;
};

// Session handling
session_start();
$_SESSION['user_id'] = 123;
$_SESSION['username'] = 'john_doe';

// Cookie handling
setcookie('preference', 'dark_mode', time() + (86400 * 30), '/');

// File upload handling
if ($_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] === 'POST' && isset($_FILES['file'])) {
    $fileName = $_FILES['file']['name'];
    $fileTmp = $_FILES['file']['tmp_name'];
    move_uploaded_file($fileTmp, 'uploads/' . $fileName);
}

// Error handling with try-catch
try {
    $result = 10 / 0;
} catch (DivisionByZeroError $e) {
    echo 'Error: Cannot divide by zero';
}
?>

practice.question: array_map() aur array_filter() mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: array_map() har array element par function apply karta hai aur new array return karta hai. array_filter() condition ke basis par elements filter karta hai.

practice.question: JSON data kaise decode karte hain PHP mein?
practice.answer: json_decode() function use karte hain. Example: $data = json_decode($jsonString, true); // true for associative array

practice.question: include aur require mein kya antar hai?
practice.answer: include file not found hone par warning deta hai, require fatal error deta hai. require_once aur include_once ek hi file ko ek baar hi include karte hain.

practice.question: Autoloading kya hai aur kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: Autoloading automatically classes load karta hai jab zaroorat hoti hai. spl_autoload_register() se implement karte hain. Composer bhi autoloading provide karta hai.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Indexed array
$fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

// Associative array
$person = [
    'name' => 'John',
    'age' => 25,
    'city' => 'New York'
];

// Multidimensional array
$students = [
    ['id' => 1, 'name' => 'Alice', 'grade' => 'A'],
    ['id' => 2, 'name' => 'Bob', 'grade' => 'B'],
    ['id' => 3, 'name' => 'Charlie', 'grade' => 'A+']
];

// array_map() example
$numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
$squared = array_map(function($n) {
    return $n * $n;
}, $numbers);

// array_filter() example
$evenNumbers = array_filter($numbers, function($n) {
    return $n % 2 === 0;
});

// JSON operations
$data = ['name' => 'John', 'age' => 30];
$json = json_encode($data); // Encode to JSON
$decoded = json_decode($json, true); // Decode to array

// File inclusion
include 'header.php';
require 'config.php';
require_once 'database.php';

// Simple autoloading example
spl_autoload_register(function ($className) {
    include 'classes/' . $className . '.php';

practice.question: PDO aur mysqli mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: PDO multiple databases support karta hai (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite), mysqli sirf MySQL. PDO prepared statements better handle karta hai aur modern API hai.

practice.question: Prepared statements kya hain aur security ke liye kyun important hain?
practice.answer: Prepared statements SQL injection se bachate hain. Query aur data separate hote hain, isliye user input directly SQL mein nahi jaata.

practice.question: SQL JOIN ke kitne types hote hain?
practice.answer: INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, FULL OUTER JOIN, CROSS JOIN. Sabse common INNER JOIN aur LEFT JOIN hain.

practice.question: Database transactions ka use kyun karte hain?
practice.answer: Multiple database operations atomic banane ke liye. Sab operations successful honge ya koi nahi hoga. Example: bank transfer mein debit aur credit dono hona chahiye.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Database connection with PDO
try {
    $pdo = new PDO(
        'mysql:host=localhost;dbname=mydb;charset=utf8mb4',
        'username',
        'password',
        [
            PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE => PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION,
            PDO::ATTR_DEFAULT_FETCH_MODE => PDO::FETCH_ASSOC
        ]
    );
} catch (PDOException $e) {
    die('Connection failed: ' . $e->getMessage());
}

// SELECT query with prepared statement
$stmt = $pdo->prepare('SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > :age');
$stmt->execute([':age' => 18]);
$users = $stmt->fetchAll();

// INSERT with prepared statement
$stmt = $pdo->prepare('INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (?, ?)');
$stmt->execute(['John Doe', 'john@example.com']);
$lastId = $pdo->lastInsertId();

// UPDATE query
$stmt = $pdo->prepare('UPDATE users SET status = :status WHERE id = :id');
$stmt->execute([':status' => 'active', ':id' => 1]);

// JOIN example
$sql = "SELECT users.name, orders.total 
        FROM users 
        INNER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id";
$result = $pdo->query($sql);

// Transaction example
try {
    $pdo->beginTransaction();
    
    // Multiple operations
    $pdo->exec('UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 100 WHERE id = 1');
    $pdo->exec('UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + 100 WHERE id = 2');
    
    $pdo->commit();
    echo 'Transaction successful!';
} catch (Exception $e) {
    $pdo->rollBack();
    echo 'Transaction failed: ' . $e->getMessage();
}
?>

practice.question: Class aur object mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Class blueprint hoti hai, object uska actual instance hota hai. Class define karti hai properties aur methods, object unka use karta hai.

practice.question: public, protected, private access modifiers ka meaning kya hai?
practice.answer: public: sab access kar sakte hain, protected: class ke andar aur child classes, private: sirf same class ke andar.

practice.question: Constructor kya hota hai?
practice.answer: Constructor special method hota hai jo object create hone par automatically call hota hai. PHP mein __construct() naam se hota hai.

practice.question: Inheritance kya hai aur kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: Inheritance ek class se dusri class properties/methods inherit karne ka process hai. extends keyword use karte hain.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Basic class definition
class Person {
    // Properties
    public string $name;
    protected int $age;
    private string $email;
    
    // Constructor
    public function __construct(string $name, int $age, string $email) {
        $this->name = $name;
        $this->age = $age;
        $this->email = $email;
    }
    
    // Method
    public function introduce(): string {
        return "Hello, my name is {$this->name} and I am {$this->age} years old.";
    }
    
    // Getter method for private property
    public function getEmail(): string {
        return $this->email;
    }
    
    // Setter method for protected property
    public function setAge(int $age): void {
        if ($age > 0) {
            $this->age = $age;
        }
    }
}

// Creating objects
$person1 = new Person('John Doe', 25, 'john@example.com');
$person2 = new Person('Jane Smith', 30, 'jane@example.com');

echo $person1->introduce();
echo $person1->getEmail();

// Inheritance
class Student extends Person {
    public string $studentId;
    public string $course;
    
    public function __construct(string $name, int $age, string $email, string $studentId, string $course) {
        parent::__construct($name, $age, $email);
        $this->studentId = $studentId;
        $this->course = $course;
    }
    
    // Method overriding
    public function introduce(): string {
        return parent::introduce() . " I am a student of {$this->course}.";
    }
}

// Static properties and methods
class MathHelper {
    public static float $pi = 3.14159;
    
    public static function add(float $a, float $b): float {
        return $a + $b;
    }
}

echo MathHelper::$pi;
echo MathHelper::add(5, 3);

// Namespaces
namespace MyApp\Models;

class User {
    // Class code
}
?>

components.tip: Follow Single Responsibility Principle - one class, one purpose

components.name: Properties and Methods

components.name: Access Modifiers

components.hinglish: Class members ki visibility control karna
components.tip: Start with private, then protected if needed, public as last resort

components.name: Inheritance

practice.question: Interface aur abstract class mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Interface sirf method signatures define karta hai (contract), abstract class partial implementation de sakta hai. Ek class multiple interfaces implement kar sakti hai, lekin ek hi class extend kar sakti hai.

practice.question: Traits kya hain aur kaise use karte hain?
practice.answer: Traits code reuse ke liye hain multiple inheritance ki tarah. use keyword se include karte hain class mein. Methods provide karte hain jo multiple classes share kar sakti hain.

practice.question: Singleton pattern kya hai aur kahan use karte hain?
practice.answer: Singleton pattern ensure karta hai ki class ka sirf ek hi instance ho. Database connections, configuration objects ke liye use karte hain.

practice.question: SOLID principles ka full form aur meaning kya hai?
practice.answer: S: Single Responsibility, O: Open-Closed, L: Liskov Substitution, I: Interface Segregation, D: Dependency Inversion. Yeh OOP design principles hain.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Interface
example
interface LoggerInterface {
    public function log(string $message): void;
}

// Abstract class
example
abstract class Animal {
    protected string $name;
    
    public function __construct(string $name) {
        $this->name = $name;
    }
    
    abstract public function makeSound(): string;
    
    public function getName(): string {
        return $this->name;
    }
}

// Trait example
trait Timestampable {
    protected \DateTime $createdAt;
    protected ?\DateTime $updatedAt = null;
    
    public function setCreatedAt(\DateTime $date): void {
        $this->createdAt = $date;
    }
    
    public function setUpdatedAt(\DateTime $date): void {
        $this->updatedAt = $date;
    }
}

// Singleton pattern
class DatabaseConnection {
    private static ?self $instance = null;
    
    private function __construct() {
        // Private constructor
    }
    
    public static function getInstance(): self {
        if (self::$instance === null) {
            self::$instance = new self();
        }
        return self::$instance;
    }
    
    public function connect(): void {
        echo "Database connected\n";
    }
}

// Magic methods example
class Product {
    private array $data = [];
    
    public function __set(string $name, $value): void {
        $this->data[$name] = $value;
    }
    
    public function __get(string $name) {
        return $this->data[$name] ?? null;
    }
    
    public function __toString(): string {
        return json_encode($this->data);
    }
}

// Factory pattern
class PaymentFactory {
    public static function create(string $type): PaymentProcessor {
        return match($type) {
            'credit_card' => new CreditCardProcessor(),
            'paypal' => new PayPalProcessor(),
            'stripe' => new StripeProcessor(),
            default => throw new InvalidArgumentException('Invalid payment type')
        };
    }
}
?>

components.name: Interfaces

components.name: Abstract Classes

components.hinglish: Classes jo instantiate nahi ki ja sakti aur abstract methods contain kar sakti hain
components.tip: Use abstract classes when you have common implementation to share

components.name: Traits

components.hinglish: Single inheritance languages mein code reuse ka mechanism
components.tip: Use traits for horizontal code sharing, not vertical inheritance
components.pros: Multiple code reuse, avoids inheritance chains
components.cons: Can cause naming conflicts, hard to trace

components.name: Design Patterns

components.hinglish: Common software design problems ke proven solutions

components.hinglish: Maintainable aur scalable OOP ke liye paanch design principles
components.tip: Start with Single Responsibility Principle - easiest to implement

practice.question: MVC architecture mein Model, View, Controller ka kya role hai?
practice.answer: Model: data aur business logic, View: presentation layer (HTML), Controller: user input handle karta hai Model aur View ke beech bridge ka kaam karta hai.

practice.question: Laravel routes kaise define karte hain?
practice.answer: routes/web.php file mein. Example: Route::get('/users', [UserController::class, 'index']);

practice.question: Eloquent ORM kya hai?
practice.answer: Laravel ka Active Record implementation jo database tables ko classes se map karta hai. Database operations object-oriented way mein karne deta hai.

practice.question: Middleware kya hota hai?
practice.answer: Middleware HTTP request aur response ke beech filter ka kaam karta hai. Authentication, logging, CORS handling ke liye use hota hai.

components.tip: Keep controllers thin - delegate business logic to models/services

practice.question: RESTful API ke principles kya hain?
practice.answer: Stateless, client-server architecture, cacheable, uniform interface, layered system. HTTP methods: GET(read), POST(create), PUT(update), DELETE(delete).

practice.question: JWT token kya hota hai?
practice.answer: JSON Web Token - compact URL-safe token jo JSON data carry karta hai. Header, payload, signature se milke banta hai. Stateless authentication ke liye use hota hai.

practice.question: GraphQL aur REST mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: REST fixed endpoints, GraphQL single endpoint with flexible queries. GraphQL mein client specify karta hai kya data chahiye, REST mein server fixed response deta hai.

practice.question: Webhooks kya hote hain?
practice.answer: Webhooks event-driven HTTP callbacks hote hain. Jab koi event hota hai (jaise payment successful), server dusre server ko HTTP POST request bhejta hai.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// RESTful API endpoint example
header('Content-Type: application/json');

$method = $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'];
$path = parse_url($_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], PHP_URL_PATH);

// Simple routing for API
if ($path === '/api/users' && $method === 'GET') {
    // Get all users
    $users = [
        ['id' => 1, 'name' => 'John', 'email' => 'john@example.com'],
        ['id' => 2, 'name' => 'Jane', 'email' => 'jane@example.com']
    ];
    echo json_encode(['success' => true, 'data' => $users]);
} elseif (preg_match('#^/api/users/(\d+)$#', $path, $matches) && $method === 'GET') {
    // Get single user
    $userId = (int)$matches[1];
    $user = ['id' => $userId, 'name' => 'John Doe', 'email' => 'john@example.com'];
    echo json_encode(['success' => true, 'data' => $user]);
} elseif ($path === '/api/users' && $method === 'POST') {
    // Create user
    $input = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);
    // Validate and process...
    $newUser = ['id' => 3, 'name' => $input['name'], 'email' => $input['email']];
    echo json_encode(['success' => true, 'data' => $newUser], JSON_PRETTY_PRINT);
} else {
    http_response_code(404);
    echo json_encode(['success' => false, 'error' => 'Endpoint not found']);
}

// JWT Authentication example (conceptual)

*/

// Third-party API call example (cURL)
$ch = curl_init();
curl_setopt_array($ch, [
    CURLOPT_URL => 'https://api.example.com/data',
    CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
    CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
        'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY',
        'Content-Type: application/json'
    ]
]);

$response = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

$data = json_decode($response, true);

// Webhook receiver example
if ($_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] === 'POST' && $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] === '/webhook/payment') {
    $payload = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);
    
    // Verify signature (important for security)
    $signature = $_SERVER['HTTP_X_SIGNATURE'] ?? '';
    $expectedSig = hash_hmac('sha256', json_encode($payload), 'your-webhook-secret');
    
    if (hash_equals($expectedSig, $signature)) {
        // Process webhook
        $event = $payload['event'];
        $data = $payload['data'];
        
        // Handle different events
        switch ($event) {
            case 'payment.succeeded':
                // Update order status
                break;
            case 'payment.failed':
                // Notify user
                break;
        }
        
        http_response_code(200);
    } else {
        http_response_code(401);
    }
}
?>

topics.title: Security Practices
topics.english: Implementing security measures and best practices in PHP applications
topics.hinglish: PHP applications mein security measures aur best practices implement karna
examples: Preventing SQL injection and XSS attacks

practice.question: SQL injection se kaise bach sakte hain?
practice.answer: Prepared statements use karke. PDO ya mysqli ke prepared statements SQL injection prevent karte hain.

practice.question: XSS attack kya hota hai aur kaise prevent karte hain?
practice.answer: Cross-Site Scripting - malicious scripts inject karna. htmlspecialchars() use kare user output display karne se pehle. Content Security Policy (CSP) headers bhi help karte hain.

practice.question: Password kaise hash karte hain securely?
practice.answer: password_hash() function use kare bcrypt ya Argon2 algorithm ke saath. Example: password_hash($password, PASSWORD_BCRYPT)

practice.question: CSRF attack kya hai aur kaise prevent karte hain?
practice.answer: Cross-Site Request Forgery - user ke naam par unauthorized actions. CSRF tokens use karte hain forms mein aur verify karte hain server side.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Input validation
$email = $_POST['email'] ?? '';
if (filter_var($email, FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL)) {
    // Valid email
    $cleanEmail = filter_var($email, FILTER_SANITIZE_EMAIL);
} else {
    // Invalid email
    die('Invalid email address');
}

// Preventing SQL Injection with PDO
$pdo = new PDO('mysql:host=localhost;dbname=test', 'user', 'pass');
$stmt = $pdo->prepare('SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = :email');
$stmt->execute([':email' => $email]);
$user = $stmt->fetch();

// Preventing XSS
$userInput = '<script>alert("XSS")</script>Hello';
$safeOutput = htmlspecialchars($userInput, ENT_QUOTES, 'UTF-8');
echo $safeOutput; // Shows as text, not executed

// Password hashing
$password = 'user_password_123';
// Hash password
$hash = password_hash($password, PASSWORD_BCRYPT);
// Verify password
if (password_verify($password, $hash)) {
    echo 'Password is valid!';
}

// CSRF Protection
session_start();
if ($_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] === 'POST') {
    if (!isset($_POST['csrf_token']) || $_POST['csrf_token'] !== $_SESSION['csrf_token']) {
        die('CSRF token validation failed');
    }
    // Process form
}

// Generate CSRF token for form
$_SESSION['csrf_token'] = bin2hex(random_bytes(32));

// Secure HTTP headers
header('Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains');
header('X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff');
header('X-Frame-Options: DENY');
header('X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block');

// Content Security Policy
header("Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' https://apis.google.com");

// File upload security
if (isset($_FILES['file'])) {
    $allowedTypes = ['image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'application/pdf'];
    $maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024; // 5MB
    
    if (!in_array($_FILES['file']['type'], $allowedTypes)) {
        die('Invalid file type');
    }
    
    if ($_FILES['file']['size'] > $maxSize) {
        die('File too large');
    }
    
    // Generate safe filename
    $extension = pathinfo($_FILES['file']['name'], PATHINFO_EXTENSION);
    $safeFilename = bin2hex(random_bytes(8)) . '.' . $extension;
    
    move_uploaded_file($_FILES['file']['tmp_name'], 'uploads/' . $safeFilename);
}

// Session security
session_start();
// Regenerate session ID periodically
if (!isset($_SESSION['created'])) {
    $_SESSION['created'] = time();
} elseif (time() - $_SESSION['created'] > 1800) { // 30 minutes
    session_regenerate_id(true);
    $_SESSION['created'] = time();
}

// Set secure session cookie params
session_set_cookie_params([
    'lifetime' => 86400,
    'path' => '/',
    'domain' => $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'],
    'secure' => true, // HTTPS only
    'httponly' => true, // HTTP only, no JS access
    'samesite' => 'Strict' // CSRF protection
]);
?>

Setting up continuous integration with GitHub Actions

practice.question: Unit test aur integration test mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Unit test individual components/functions ko alag-alag test karta hai (isolated). Integration test multiple components ko ek saath test karta hai ki woh sahi se work kar rahe hain.

practice.question: TDD (Test-Driven Development) ka process kya hai?
practice.answer: TDD mein pehle test likhte hain (jo fail hoga), phir minimal code likhte hain test pass karne ke liye, phir code refactor karte hain. Red-Green-Refactor cycle follow karte hain.

practice.question: Mock objects kya hain aur kyun use karte hain?
practice.answer: Mock objects fake objects hote hain jo real objects ki tarah behave karte hain. External dependencies (database, APIs) ko isolate karne ke liye use karte hain taki tests fast aur independent rahein.

practice.question: Continuous Integration (CI) kya hai aur kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: CI ek practice hai jisme developers regularly code integrate karte hain, aur automated tests run hote hain. GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI use karte hain. Har commit par tests automatically run hote hain.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// PHPUnit Test Example
use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

class CalculatorTest extends TestCase
{
    public function testAddReturnsCorrectSum()
    {
        $calculator = new Calculator();
        $result = $calculator->add(2, 3);
        $this->assertEquals(5, $result);
    }
    
    public function testDivideByZeroThrowsException()
    {
        $this->expectException(DivisionByZeroError::class);
        
        $calculator = new Calculator();
        $calculator->divide(10, 0);
    }
    
    public function testAddWithDataProvider()
    {
        $calculator = new Calculator();
        $this->assertEquals(4, $calculator->add(2, 2));
        $this->assertEquals(10, $calculator->add(5, 5));
        $this->assertEquals(0, $calculator->add(-5, 5));
    }
}

// Calculator class being tested
class Calculator
{
    public function add(float $a, float $b): float
    {
        return $a + $b;
    }
    
    public function divide(float $a, float $b): float
    {
        if ($b == 0) {
            throw new DivisionByZeroError('Cannot divide by zero');
        }
        return $a / $b;
    }
}

// Mock example with PHPUnit
class UserServiceTest extends TestCase
{
    public function testGetUserEmail()
    {
        // Create a mock UserRepository
        $userRepoMock = $this->createMock(UserRepository::class);
        
        // Configure the mock to return specific data
        $userRepoMock->method('findById')
                     ->willReturn(new User(1, 'john@example.com'));
        
        $userService = new UserService($userRepoMock);
        $email = $userService->getUserEmail(1);
        
        $this->assertEquals('john@example.com', $email);
    }
}

});

test('division by zero throws exception', function () {
    $calculator = new Calculator();
    $calculator->divide(10, 0);
})->throws(DivisionByZeroError::class);
*/

// Integration Test Example
databaseTest('User can be created and retrieved', function () {
    // Setup test database
    $pdo = new PDO('sqlite::memory:');
    $pdo->exec('CREATE TABLE users (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, email TEXT)');
    
    $userRepo = new UserRepository($pdo);
    
    // Test create user
    $userId = $userRepo->create('test@example.com');
    $this->assertIsInt($userId);
    
    // Test retrieve user

    $this->assertEquals('test@example.com', $user->email);
});

components.name: PHPUnit
components.english: The standard testing framework for PHP applications
components.hinglish: PHP applications ke liye standard testing framework
components.tip: Follow Arrange-Act-Assert pattern in test methods
components.pros: Industry standard, comprehensive features, good documentation

components.name: Test-Driven Development (TDD)
components.english: Development methodology where tests are written before code
components.hinglish: Development methodology jahan code se pehle tests likhe jaate hain
components.tip: Start with simple tests and gradually increase complexity
components.pros: Better code design, regression protection, documentation

components.name: Mocking and Stubs
components.english: Creating fake objects to isolate components during testing
components.hinglish: Testing ke dauran components ko isolate karne ke liye fake objects banana
components.tip: Mock external dependencies, test internal logic separately
components.pros: Faster tests, isolated testing, control over dependencies
components.cons: Can mask integration issues, setup complexity

components.name: Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)
components.english: Testing methodology focused on system behavior and user stories
components.hinglish: Testing methodology jo system behavior aur user stories par focus karti hai
components.tip: Use Gherkin syntax (Given-When-Then) for clear specifications

components.name: Continuous Integration (CI)
components.english: Practice of regularly integrating code changes with automated testing
components.hinglish: Regularly code changes integrate karna aur automated testing karna
components.tip: Start with simple CI pipeline and gradually add more checks
components.pros: Early bug detection, quality assurance, team confidence
